messages.body:
From:Barrister Bosco Moses Cr.
Bills & Exchange Manager
FIRST ACTIVE SOCIETY
4th,floor mary land nigera.
dear,anybody
PRIVATE AND URGENT.
I am contacting you in regards to a business transfer of a huge sum of money from a deceased account.Though I know that a transaction of this magnitude will make anyone apprehensive and worried, but I am assuring you that all will be well at the end of the day. We decided to contact you due to the urgency of this transaction.
PROPOSITION;
We discovered an abandoned sum of (Nine Million United states Dollars) in an account that belongs to one of our foreign customers who died along with his entire family. Since his death, none of his next-of-kin or relations has come forward to lay claims to this money as the heir. We cannot release the fund from his account unless someone applies for claim as the next-of-kin to the deceased as indicated in our banking guidelines. Upon this discovery, we now seek your permission to have you stand as a next of kin to the deceased as all documentations will be carefully worked out by us for the funds (Nine Million United states Dollars) to be released in your favour as the beneficiary's next of kin.
It may interest you to note that we have secured from the probate an order of madamus to locate any of deceased beneficiaries. Please acknowledge receipt of this message in acceptance of our mutual business endeavour by furnishing me with the following;
1. Your Full Names and Address.
2. Direct Telephone and Fax numbers.
These requirements will enable us file a letter of claim to the appropriate departments for necessary approvals in your favour before the transfer can be made. We shall be compensating you with 1 Million Dollars on final conclusion of this project, while the rest shall be for us. Your share stays with you while the rest shall be for us for investment purposes in your country. If this proposal is acceptable by you, do not take undue advantage of the trust we have bestowed in you, I await your urgent email. please reply to this email barr_boscomoses@yahoo.com
FOR MORE CONFIRMATION CALL 2348023317115.


Regards,
Barrister Bosco MosesCr.

messages.body:
Gentlemen,

I don't suppose there are any photographs of Mr. Torres around, are there? 
Or did he have any distinguishing physical characteristics or facial tics or 
speech impediments? I ask this so that if, by chance, Fernando inquires, 
Mikhail will be able to confidently answer, "Why yes, the man did have only 
one eye," for example, or, "Why, certainly, cousin Filippo was unable to 
pronounce the letter S without spitting all over hell's half acre."

It may be as well to get as complete a description of the deceased as 
possible. Death certificates and medical reports are all very well, but I, 
for one, like to have all bases covered, as we Americans say. I think no one 
will disagree, gentlemen, when I say that there are times when modalities 
hang by a thread. This may well be one of those times.

Ballcocks at the ready, gents.

I remain,

Bernard "Barry" Lenner

Gentlemen,

Why in the hell would anyone own two duplexes? Why not sell them and just 
buy one big home? I am not sure what this says about Mr. Osucko's business 
sense, but I fear little good.

The golfing down here is superb, and the local delicacy, crudd fish, is both 
subtle and exciting. Paired with a nice gewurztraminer, it's a little white, 
flaky plate of heaven. Can't wait for the "skins" tournament tomorrow, and 
crudd gumbo.

God bless Florida.

Yours, etc.
Bernard "Barry" Lenner
 

 
 Lenner-san

Unfortunately Fernando, Bossk and ourselves have parted company. The pair of them were too stupid and lazy to respond to our emails and we have not heard from them since Sunday. This is completely unacceptable and indicative of the kind of morons we have to deal with in these situations.

The ball was in their court and they failed miserably to do anything with it. Presumably they are too busy getting amorous with goats, or pimping their diseased mothers around their village.

It is a sad case of affairs when even the prospect of making millions does not motivate these useless bush men.

Remain blessed,
Phil
